byline.original: Correspondence of The New-York Daily Times

docs.abstract: After the Coup - corresp. of the Times
docs.lead_paragraph: As all the democratic journals, such as the Presse, Republique, National, and so forth, have ceased to exist; as no paper is permitted to appeal which expresses any opinion hostile to the government; as martial law reigns throughout a fourth of the empire, and military courts take the place of the trial by jury, it is extremely difficult or quite impossible to give you an idea of the real state of political feeling throughout France.

headline.main: EUROPE.; FRANCE. Events of the Day in Paris, by a Looker-on--The Storming of Barricades--Political Antecedents and Prospects. State of the Provinces-Arrests-Adhesions-The Foreign Ministers-State of the Country, &c. The Voting--How it is Conducted-A new Mode of obtaining the Results of Universal Suffrage-The Anglo-Alliance Question-Sundry Anecdotes and Incidents. The Elections--How they are Managed--Arrests--The Pope, &c. English Views of the French Usurpation--Refugees in England-Kossuth in America &c., &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. MORGAN introduced a bill to incorporate the NewYork and Galway Steamship Company, and also gave notice of a bill to amend the militia law. Mr. BEEKMAN gave notice of a bill prescribing the method of changing the grades of streets in New-York. Mr. CROLEY offered a series of KOSSUTH resolutions, similar to what Mr. Underwood offered in the House yesterday.

headline.main: LATEST INTELLIGENCE; By Telegraph to The New-York Daily Times NEW-YORK LEGISLATURE. SENATE ASSEMBLY.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

docs.abstract: Speech at Congressional dinner to Kossuth
docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. KOSSUTH received with much emotion, the intelligence of his mother's and sisters' imprisonment by the infamous Austrian. It adds another to his load of care and sorrow, which would depress and discourage, did not his noble, self-sacrificing spirit reach forth and gather strength from the whisperings of hope, and see a future for his country and his race well worth the struggle.
